reasoning: Gram-positive bacteremia (Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus, Enterococcus) is increasingly common with rising MRSA prevalence. Community estimates: ~20-40 per 100k person-years, varying significantly by geography and healthcare setting. Hospital-acquired rates much higher. Global estimate ~35 per 100k accounts for both community and healthcare-associated infections.
source: Estimated from CDC/WHO epidemiological surveillance data on bloodstream infections and MRSA prevalence; geographic variation high due to healthcare infrastructure differences
